datastructures.name: Array
datastructures.description: An array is a collection of elements identified by index or key. The elements are stored in contiguous memory locations, which allows for fast access to elements at any position using the index.
datastructures.usecase: Used for storing data elements of the same type. It's useful when you know the size of the dataset in advance and need fast access by index.

datastructures.name: LinkedList
datastructures.description: A linked list consists of nodes where each node contains a data field and a reference(link) to the next node in the sequence. This structure allows for efficient insertion and removal of elements from any position in the sequence.
datastructures.usecase: Useful when you need dynamic data storage, or when the number of data elements is unknown upfront and frequently changes.
